Package hjb.msg.codec

Provides the classes and interface needed to allow values of various Java types encountered in JMS messages to be encoded into and decoded from strings that are suitable for inclusion in either the body or headers of a HTTP message.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
TypedValueCodec TypedValueCodec declares methods used to assist translation between the different representation of property/header values in JMS Messages and HJBMessages.
 

Class Summary
BaseValueCodec BaseValueCodec implements methods useful methods for implementations of TypedValueCodec
BooleanCodec BooleanCodec is used to encode/decode between boolean property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
ByteArrayCodec ByteArrayCodec is used to encode/decode between byte array values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages.
ByteCodec ByteCodec is used to encode/decode between byte property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
CharCodec CharCodec is used to encode/decode between char values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages.
DoubleCodec DoubleCodec is used to encode/decode between short property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
FloatCodec FloatCodec is used to encode/decode between float property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
IntCodec IntCodec is used to encode/decode between integer property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages.
LongCodec LongCodec is used to encode/decode between long property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
OrderedTypedValueCodec OrderedTypedValueCodec is used to encode/decode between property values of all types in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages

It achieves this by chaining together the TypedValueCodecs defined in the package hjb.msg so that any valid encoded/decoded property value is correctly handled.
ShortCodec ShortCodec is used to encode/decode between short property values in JMS Messages and string values in HJBMessages
StringCodec StringCodec is used to encode/decode between String property values in JMS Messages and their string representations in HJBMessages
 

Package hjb.msg.codec Description

Provides the classes and interface needed to allow values of various Java types encountered in JMS messages to be encoded into and decoded from strings that are suitable for inclusion in either the body or headers of a HTTP message.

TypeValueCodec defines the methods required for encoding and decoding any type. There are implementations of this interface to support boolean, char, byte, short, int, long, byte array, double, float and string values. All implementations in this package are actually subclasses of BaseValueCodec, which provides various utility methods used by all, and standard implementations of methods of Object.

OrderedTypedValueCodec is an implementation of the TypeValueCodec interface that combines all the other implementations in this package and should be used when the type to be encoded/decoded is unknown.
